comments.body: Sounds like an Illusioner thing. Also, Vampires
maybe it would be safer if the cat would glow and have a bit of an obsidian structure.
I like the idea is perfect!
This kinda defeats the purpose of mushroom islands, the point of them is to be very safe and hostile mob free, that's why they are so rare
like a mushroom monster
They are actually not that easy. As shown by the youtuber NiftySmith, there is no way to obtain wood on a mushroom island unless a mineshaft generates. And a mineshaft means hostile mobs.
I like the idea of a few mushroom based hostile mobs, but perhaps they should be rare. Other than that i like it.
I like your idea.

This is a good idea because it makes sense in real life too and colorful slime will be perfect with redstone to blend in with the surroundings like a swamp biome: it could be dark green to make the contraption look a lot more gunky looking, and a mountain biome make some slime look white and some gray to make it look like it has been there for a while and as if it has been there for a while That the slime has changed by what it has been touching, it also makes sense in real life because slime gets dirty after touching dirty stuff
There are already pandas, bees, and also axolotls have been announced for release in 1.17.
The archeology could add this isn't not just pots ist gonna be huge
Yeah, I know, but i think that there should be more

A small recommendation, maybe add some animals to your post that you think should be added, like maybe fireflies or the cheetah. Also, I feel Mojang Studios already try to do this in the current updates, with the pandas, polar bears, bees, and axolotls.
I'm just imagining a regular zombie with a red mushroom on its head lol. But hostile mobs don't spawn in mooshroom biomes sadly
Shafiq Zulhaqim
This is cool. Perhaps they could have slight changes, like the Husk and Drowned?
Or some zombies are holding meat from animals; not that they would attack animals, but that they spawn holding some meats like beef, mutton, pork, or even rotten flesh.

I thought of the idea of these post-Enderdragon temples on the far reaches of the End called Obelisk. They're tall Obsidian towers that are guarded by Ender Mantas on the outside so you couldn't stack blocks up to the top where the treasure is without Ender Mantas knocking you off, you'd be forced to enter the Obelisk's Maze and Monsters. And at the top is where you get your first Elytra (instead of at the End Cities). So then you could fly from the top to the bottom and the Elytra is a real challenge to aquire
I made this assuming the deep dark is at the bottom of the world everywhere
Thats a good idea, but it might be better to have only one or two spawn with it, and it wont respawn

I really like this idea for several reasons. It would make the deep dark a sort of final biome for the overworld, like a last hurrah before moving on to the end. It would also make the strongholds a more interesting experience, there's no challenge, or even any replay ability outside of trying to find the end portal. Lastly, it would tie into the lore of Minecraft really well, we have ruined nether portals with nether blocks slowly creeping into the overworld, and the deep dark strongly resembles the end theme, with lots of lavenders and blue-blacks, so maybe the deep dark is the result of a ruined end portal
I thought about this, and I hope Mojang team did too! In fact, I bet this is the case, but if not, I want them to hear about this.
I think a herbivore snake that eats glowberries would be fantastic! It will be a neutral mob that can be tamed by feeding glowberries.
Already ahead of you man for the lush caves i have an idea and its a great one
I think a man eating plant or a giant centipede would be cool.
This! I have lost so many wolves because Minecraft dogs can't swim. Real dogs can swim, lol.
Great idea! The shipwreck is basically just a ruin; there's no story behind it.

Good idea since Drowned spawn in open oceans anyway. Perhaps they'd have higher nautilus drop rates? One concern is shipwrecks help (especially speedrunning) players get some decent loot early in the game; a mini-boss mob might render them non-viable. Maybe they only spawn in shipwrecks in certain biomes and/or below a certain Y level?
actually thats not a bad idea
I think the special name should be “Frienderman” or “Friend”

Not only for enderman although I think frienderman is a brilliant idea. But how about a name tag that makes any hostile mobs friendly e.g. pillagers, witches, and other humanoids would make for cool and alternative settlers.
YES!! As a bunny owner I want this feature so so bad
while there are raids, I am pretty bored with just illagers, so I think it is better to add zombie invasions/botnets that will attack villages at night.

I feel like this has happened to me. I was playing minecraft with my siblings and just like 60 zombies came flooding into our village. It was crazy but this isn't about the post. Sorry for wasting your time

Zombie Sieges exist. If a village (player-created or natural) has at least 20 villagers and 10 beds, a zombie siege can start at midnight by a chance of 10%. If it does happen, attempts will be made to spawn A LOT of zombies. This is basically what happened with Houndoom Thibou.
THIS IS SOOOOOOO COOOOOOOOOL

What if it was more like a horse but it gives you a higher nausea effect the longer your on it and it takes more time to tame considering it could do damage or knock back so it should be hard to tame.

Yes, I agree. It could also require a lead as well as a saddle because Hoglins are so ferocious. There could even be an achievement called Hog Rider or War Hog you could get by doing it. Because they are war-like, you could also equip iron Hog armor to them.

The Hoglin shouldn't control like the horse... it should control like a Pig. They could use a new item called a "Crimson Fungus on a Stick" (since they have Warped Fungus on a Stick already). Taming it wouldn't do anything more than make it not aggressive towards you.

Using a Warped Fungus on a stick while riding it would make it run backwards instead of forwards, because Hoglins hate Warped Fungus.
50 health points? A diamond sword does 7 damage, so it would be killed in 8 hits with a diamond sword. I like the idea, but maybe more health???
I like it
ok my friend thats already a bug in the game we dont need him as a boss mob hes already unkillble and his name is null my friend you saw him reset your game you dont want him around
yes! I agree
Place Holder

I see this happening. Like for a swamp, it could have mud all over him with a blue orchid on his head, and for the ocean/beach biome, it could have sand sprinkled on it with seaweed on it as well, and maybe a lonesome baby turtle could mount it. I think iron golems should defend all baby animals without a mom, so it can be more than just a village protector. I really hope Mojang accepts this.

-Vaporeon Boi (Mobile)
They would be more passive then friendly, but it's a good idea nonetheless!

398338750492 Yeah thanks! The point was not to do a simple mob that attacks the player or gives new items and stuff but actually to change the mechanics of how the player had to mine, because basically, when you play the game, you get to a point where some basic activities like mining or just randomly exploring become quite easy because you have the best armour. So, instead of being a direct threat to the player and attack with brute force, messing up with his habits and forcing him to put himself in danger despite the armour or weapon he has can be another way of being a threat. That's what i wanted, a mob that changes the way the player acts in his surroundings.

Anyway thanks a lot for your comment and i hope you like my idea!
Subject adjusted to improve search results, please leave it alone.
I was literally about to make a post just like this, I happy I found this and I want to see it added
but the pigs should only dance to pigstep or more pig-themed music.
Great idea!

Everyone loves watching parrots and allays dance, perhaps copper golems could do the same thing? This would definitely make them more interesting and give me a reason to bring way too many carved pumpkins to the trial chambers.
They should also have less health since they are smaller.
I think their hitbox should be a little bit larger too
I agree

Mojang definitely knows how Ph1lza died in his hardcore world because if I remember correctly they made a splash text about it but it's been a long time since then so I guess they aren't doing anything about them... but it's never too late!
Slightly larger hitbox, less health, slower speed, less damage. All those would make the baby zombie a fair mob for its size and appearance.
I think it should be orange just like lava to show that it has adapted to its environment and have appropriate camouflage.

393603513332, while I do agree that it blending in would improve the mob. I put its colors so it stands out, that way it warns "predators" not to get to close. It does not need to be specifically the color I mentioned, I feel it should at least pop out a little bit. Maybe if it was a darker shade of orange so you would see it if you really looked?
Maybe it could be related to the strider and be dark red with gray basalt growths.
I LOVE THIS IDEA
I really like the idea. It would be cool for the jukebox to have a use like that, but might be complicated to implement.
There could be Cave Drawings which would go well with the other Archaeological stuff.
I'm not sure jukeboxes should be used in this. Perhaps there are just different Cave Paintings that do different things when activated
When player is near these paintings, a some kind of mysterious soundtrack should start playing, because jukeboxes don't fit in those caves. Just my opinion ;).
Great Idea. They should also throw splash potions of fire resistance at the babies when they are caught on fire too.
I would say clubs. Pitchforks are a lot like the tridents that drowned have. Not to mention, Piglins are new and in the Nether which has always kinda had more of a "chaotic" feel to it.
Yeah actually clubs would be better than pitchforks. I hope they can add this before 1.16!

I like the idea of pitchforks and clubs. Maybe the pitchfork could be a non-throwable variant of the trident that attacks in a straight line, and the club could be a low damage weapon that can stun enemies, or you can swap the stun for bleeding by crafting a club with iron nuggets.
